intro: Conostephium hortiorum, commonly known as the yellow mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow inflorescences that resemble dandelion flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Conostephium hortiorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
